CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

1. PIDT-C12NT: This is the name of a specific polymer, where "PIDT" is an acronym for the polymer backbone, "C12" refers to the linear dodecyl side chain, and "NT" stands for naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole).
2. PIDT-EHNT: This is the name of another polymer, where "PIDT" is the same as before, "EH" refers to the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain, and "NT" is the same as in PIDT-C12NT.
3. PIDT-DTNT: This is the name of yet another polymer, where "PIDT" is the same as before, "DT" refers to the linear hexyl side chain, and "NT" is the same as in PIDT-C12NT and PIDT-EHNT.
4. IDT: Indacenodithiophene is a specific type of polymer backbone mentioned in the paragraph.
5. NT: Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) is a specific type of polymer backbone mentioned in the paragraph.
6. PC71BM: This is the name of a material used in the solar cell devices.

These are the "Material Name" entities identified in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PIDT-C12NT
2. PIDT-EHNT
3. PIDT-DTNT
4. IDT
5. NT
6. PC71BM

These are the Material Name entities mentioned in the paragraph. All other entities are not directly related to specific materials.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PIDT-EHNT |
| PIDT-DTNT |
| IDT |
| NT |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

1. J sc (Junction solar cell): The current density at the maximum power point of a solar cell.
2. FF (Fill Factor): A measure of the efficiency of a solar cell at converting solar energy into electrical energy.
3. PIDT-C12NT: A specific type of conjugated polymer.
4. Morphology: The physical structure and arrangement of a material.
5. Domain size: The size of a specific phase or region within a material.
6. Charge carrier mobility: The ability of a material to conduct electricity by moving charged particles.
7. Exciton: An excited state of a molecule or atom, formed when an electron is raised to a higher energy level.
8. EQE (External quantum efficiency): A measure of the efficiency of a solar cell at converting photons into electrical current.
9. EQEs (External quantum efficiency spectra): Graphical representation of the external quantum efficiency as a function of wavelength.
10. PIDT-EHNT: A specific type of conjugated polymer with a branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain.
11. PIDT-DTNT: A specific type of conjugated polymer with a linear hexyl side chain.
12. PIDT-IDT: A specific type of conjugated polymer with indacenodithiophene and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) units.
13. Stille copolymerization: A type of organic reaction used to synthesize polymers.
14. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital): The energy level of the last electron in a molecule.
15. Open circuit voltage: The voltage at which no current flows in a solar cell under open circuit conditions.
16. Solar cell devices: Devices used to convert solar energy into electrical energy.
17. Backbone planarity: The degree of flatness of the main molecular structure of a polymer.
18. Bulk heterojunction film: A thin film made up of two or more materials that are intimately mixed at the molecular level.
19. PC71BM: A specific type of fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in organic solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. J sc (Junction solar cell current density)
2. FF (Fill Factor)
3. Morphology
4. Domain size
5. Charge carrier mobility
6. Exciton
7. EQE (External quantum efficiency)
8. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital energy level)
9. Open circuit voltage
10. Backbone planarity
11. Charge carrier mobility of bulk heterojunction film
12. Optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Junction solar cell current density (J sc) |
| Fill Factor (FF) |
| Morphology |
| Domain size |
| Charge carrier mobility |
| Exciton |
| External quantum efficiency (EQE) |
| Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital energy level (HOMO) |
| Open circuit voltage |
| Backbone planarity |
| Charge carrier mobility of bulk heterojunction film |
| Optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

1. Jsc (Junction voltage scanning current density): The paragraph mentions the Jsc (junction scanning current density) of PIDT-C12NT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-EHNT being 9.72 mA cm^-2, 7.83 mA cm^-2, and 4.18 mA cm^-2, respectively.

2. FF (Fill Factor): The paragraph mentions that the FF (fill factor) of PIDT-C12NT was higher than those of the other two polymers, but no specific values are given.

3. Absorption Coefficient: The paragraph states that the increased Jsc of PIDT-C12NT may be attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient. No specific value is given, but it can be inferred that it is a coefficient with units of inverse length (e.g., cm^-1).

4. External quantum efficiency (EQE): The paragraph mentions the EQE (external quantum efficiency) values for the three polymers, which are 4.18%, 7.83%, and 9.72%.

5. Current density: The paragraph mentions the calculated current densities from the EQE measurement for the three polymers, which are 4.18 mA cm^-2, 7.83 mA cm^-2, and 9.72 mA cm^-2.

6. HOMO level: The paragraph mentions that all polymers showed relatively deep HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital) levels. No specific values are given.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Jsc (Junction voltage scanning current density): The Jsc (junction scanning current density) of PIDT-C12NT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-EHNT are 9.72 mA cm^-2, 7.83 mA cm^-2, and 4.18 mA cm^-2, respectively.

2. FF (Fill Factor): The FF (fill factor) of PIDT-C12NT is higher than those of the other two polymers, but no specific value is given.

3. Absorption Coefficient: The absorption coefficient of PIDT-C12NT is enhanced, but no specific value is given.

4. External quantum efficiency (EQE): The EQE (external quantum efficiency) values for the three polymers are 4.18%, 7.83%, and 9.72%.

5. HOMO level: The HOMO levels of the three polymers are relatively deep, but no specific values are given.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property          | Value                          |
|------------------|-------------------------------|
| Jsc (PIDT-C12NT) | 9.72 mA cm^-2                |
| Jsc (PIDT-DTNT)   | 7.83 mA cm^-2                |
| Jsc (PIDT-EHNT)   | 4.18 mA cm^-2                |
| FF (PIDT-C12NT)   | (Not specified)               |
| Absorption Coefficient (PIDT-C12NT) | (Enhanced, no specific value given) |
| EQE (PIDT-C12NT)   | 9.72 %                      |
| EQE (PIDT-DTNT)   | 7.83 %                      |
| EQE (PIDT-EHNT)   | 4.18 %                      |
| HOMO level (all polymers) | (Relatively deep, no specific values given) |
